blorbs.text: A few months ago, I made a raft for my dog out of wood and PVC pipe. I wanted something that could hold a grill and coolers, but was also stable enough for a tiny dog.

I wanted something made out of wood that resembled a deck, so I planned for a diagonal pattern. I chose 6" common board from Home Depot, because it was cheap, thin, sturdy, and wide enough so that I didnt have to make a lot of cuts. When I made my initial measurements and cuts, I was keeping all of the pieces close - until a friend recommended to spread them out so that water wouldn't pool in the middle. So I spaced them out at exactly the length of half of a wii-u jewel case.
